If the optometrist is next to the shoe store, the businesses immediately on either side of this pair must be
Choices:
A) the pharmacy and a restaurant
B) the pharmacy and the toy store
C) the two restaurants
D) a restaurant and the toy store
E) a restaurant and the veterinarian
chain_of_thought:
The optometrist is next to the shoe store, so the pharmacy must be next to the optometrist.
The toy store cannot be next to the veterinarian.
The two restaurants must be separated by at least two other businesses.
full_output:
<cot_start>
The optometrist is next to the shoe store, so the pharmacy must be next to the optometrist.
The toy store cannot be next to the veterinarian.
The two restaurants must be separated by at least two other businesses.
<cot_end>
Answer: A

Choices:
A) Trustcorp owns a class 1 building.
B) Trustcorp owns the Meyer Building.
C) Southco owns a class 2 Building.

E) Southco owns the Flores Tower.

RealProp owns Garza Tower (class 1), Yates House (class 3), and Zimmer House (class 3).
Southco owns Flores Tower (class 1) and Lynch Building (class 2).
Trustcorp owns King Building, Meyer Building, and Ortiz Building, all of which are class 2.
full_output:

RealProp owns Garza Tower (class 1), Yates House (class 3), and Zimmer House (class 3).
Southco owns Flores Tower (class 1) and Lynch Building (class 2).
Trustcorp owns King Building, Meyer Building, and Ortiz Building, all of which are class 2.

Answer: C
